meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Hello there, fellow gamers! It's your favorite grog reviewer here, and I'm paws-itively excited to dive into the world of Cat Quest. Now, before we start, let me just say that I'm not exactly what you'd call a cat lady (although my cat-loving friend says I'm more like a cat- whisperer). So, take my review for what it's worth - a grog's honest opinion!

Let's get down to business! Cat Quest is an action RPG that's all about, well, cats. You play as a feline protagonist on a quest to save your mom (yes, really), and along the way, you'll encounter various cat puns, adorable kittens, and even some catnip (just kidding, that's just my fantasy). But in all seriousness, Cat Quest is a charming game with some great visuals, solid RPG action, and an overall fun adventure. It's best enjoyed in bursts to avoid the repetitive quest structure.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But [Grog Reviewer], what about the critics?" Ah, yes! Let me give you a quick rundown of what they had to say. Worth Playing gave it 78/100 and said it was best enjoyed in short sessions. Nintendo Life scored it 70/100 and mentioned that if you're not a cat lover, you might want to overlook some of the more...exuberant design choices. SpazioGames went with a score of 60/100 and called it "a game that can bring a smile to gamers." And finally, God is a Geek gave it an impressive 80/100 and said it's perfect for newcomers to RPGs and cat enthusiasts alike!

So, what do I think? Well, I'll keep my review short and sweet (like a cat!). Cat Quest is a fun game that's perfect for a quick play session or two. The visuals are adorable, the combat is solid, and the cat puns are...well, let's just say they're purr-fectly ridiculous. It's not going to win any awards for complexity or depth, but sometimes that's exactly what you need - a lighthearted, easy-to-pick-up game that'll keep you entertained.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a fun, feline-filled adventure that won't take up too much of your time, Cat Quest is the purr-fect choice. Just don't forget to bring some catnip (just kidding again, or am I?). Happy gaming, and remember: always keep your whiskers sharp!
